Package frogger.world.levels

Class Level

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.Parent
javafx.scene.layout.Region
javafx.scene.layout.Pane
frogger.world.World
frogger.world.levels.Level
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.util.EventListener, javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
Direct Known Subclasses:
LevelEight, LevelFive, LevelFour, LevelNine, LevelOne, LevelRandom, LevelSeven, LevelSix, LevelThree, LevelTwo
public abstract class Level
extends World
implements java.beans.PropertyChangeListener
Level is the base abstract class which all Frogger levels must be a subclass of. Each instance of Level may act as the root node of the JavaFX scene graph. Level provides the generation of all child nodes that must exist in all Frogger levels such as Animal and BackgroundImage. Level also contains a HighscoreController that will handle keeping track of highscores for each level. Level implements Java Beans PropertyChangeListener to listen to changes in highscore and the number of end goals reached by the user.

  • Field Details

    • SECTION_HEIGHT

      public static final double SECTION_HEIGHT
      A constant that specifies the height of every row in the Frogger game.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • animal

      private final Animal animal
      A reference to the Animal instance. This is the character the player controls. Only one should exists per level.

    • ends

      private final java.util.ArrayList<End> ends
      An ArrayList of all the end goals in the level. Exactly five must exist per level.

    • digits

      private final java.util.ArrayList<Digit> digits
      An ArrayList storing the digits to be displayed as the score.

    • highscoreController

      private final HighscoreController highscoreController
      A reference to the HighscoreController instance that handles all logic regarding player highscores.

  • Constructor Details

    • Level

      public Level​(int levelNumber, double waterBoundary)
      Creates a Level with a HighscoreController. A BackgroundImage is created based on the levelNumber parameter. Images for level backgrounds must be name "background_level[levelNumber].png" in the background images directory. An Animal instance is also created which uses the waterBoundary parameter for it's collision checking. A Level instance listens to a user pressing the ESC key and will call NavController.navigateTo(Class) to navigate to MainMenu.
      Parameters:
      levelNumber - Specifies the level number corresponding to the level.
      waterBoundary - Specifies the y-coordinate where the water region begins in the level.

  • Method Details

    • act

      public void act​(long now)
      Empty act method. Called every frame by AnimationTimer.
      Specified by:
      act in class World
      Parameters:
      now - Time in nanoseconds. Passed as argument from AnimationTimer.handle().

    • getAnimal

      public Animal getAnimal()
      Obtain the instance of Animal in the Level.
      Returns:
      The instance of Animal.

    • setNumber

      public void setNumber​(int n)
      Changes the score display to match the parameter.
      Parameters:
      n - Specifies the value to display as the score.

    • start

      public void start()
      Resets the level and calls World.start(). Resets instances of Animal and End. Sets score to display 0.
      Overrides:
      start in class World

    • win

      private void win()
      Stops the timer and calls a dialog popup which either prompts for user input or displays the current highscores. Called when all instances of End have been activated. Called by Java Beans PropertyChangeListener.

    • displayHighscores

      private void displayHighscores()
      Displays the current highscores as an Alert.

    • propertyChange

      public void propertyChange​(java.beans.PropertyChangeEvent evt)
      Method from Beans PropertyChangeListener which is called when observed property is modified. Called when a PropertyChangeSupport fires an event.
      Specified by:
      propertyChange in interface java.beans.PropertyChangeListener
      Parameters:
      evt - Specifies the event fired by the PropertyChangeSupport
